page.title: 13GENERAL
page.content: {COMMUNICATIONS}:-The local telephone exchange is behind the Spar shop in Danehill which also houses the post office. The post is sorted in Redhill. All postal services are applicable. {MEMORIALS}:-The Danehill war memorial is to 45 who died in the Great war and 18 who died in World War 2. Danehill church is a memorial to one of the Hardys from Danehurst. {ART & CRAFTS}:-Edward Gibbon and Giles Moore both wrote books in the area. Knife-sharpening is a local craft as is curtain making. {SPORT}:-Popular childrens sports are tennis, cricket, and soccer, which are played by the two schools. Amongst the elders, pheasant shooting, fox-hunting and stool-ball are popular. {FASHION}:-Most wear unfashionable clothes. only a few follow the trends.
